title: Michael Howard – 2004 Speech on Gibraltar
author: admin
summary: Below is the text of the speech made by Michael Howard, the then Leader of the Opposition, on 17th May 2004.
content:
[![michaelhoward2](https://www.ukpol.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/michaelhoward2-199x300.jpg)](https://www.ukpol.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/michaelhoward2.jpg)
  *[ISIL]: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations
  *[GDP]: Gross Domestic Product
  *[UCL]: University College London
  *[HIV]: human immunodeficiency virus
  *[AI]: artificial intelligence
  *[ABI]: Association of British Insurers

  *[OECD]: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development

I am honoured to be with you today in Gibraltar, just as I was at your National Day in 2002.

  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals

Today is the eighth anniversary of Peter Caruna’s election as Prime Minister of Gibraltar.

  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals

  *[UN]: United Nations

But it was three hundred years ago that Gibraltar became British.

  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund

There are those who would wish to overturn three hundred years of history and separate Gibraltar from the United Kingdom.

  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund

The Conservatives will never surrender Gibraltar’s sovereignty without the specific mandate of the people of Gibraltar.

  *[GDP]: Gross Domestic Product

_“An incoming Conservative government will not be bound by any agreement to surrender Gibraltar’s sovereignty which has been reached without the consent of the people of Gibraltar. We will disown this Government’s agreement in principle to share sovereignty with Spain…Britain and Spain should now discuss those matters where agreement can be reached. They do not include the issue of sovereignty”._

  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals

And let me remind the Labour Government what it says in your Constitution, drawn up when a Labour Government was last in power, in 1969.

_“… Her Majesty’s Government have given assurances to the people of Gibraltar that Gibraltar will remain part of Her Majesty’s dominions unless and until an Act of Parliament otherwise provides and furthermore that Her Majesty’s Government will never enter into arrangements under which the people of Gibraltar would pass under the sovereignty of another state against their freely and democratically expressed wishes”._

  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund

Those member states which wish to integrate more closely should be free to do so. But they should not drag Britain and quite possibly some other member states reluctantly in their wake. We would say to our partners: ‘We don’t want to stop you doing what you want to do, as long as you don’t make us do what we don’t want to do’.
